CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 10, 1967, pg. 17, reads: "AKA Sorrors [sic] - Prior to the ball, this trio of hard-working AKA Sorors got together to look over some of the African pieces which were on display at the group's 'Ajoyo' at the Flying Carpet. From left: Sorors Nan Currington, chairman; Edythe Perkins and Janet Thompson, co-chairman.  The girls planned an excellent evening of social and cultural enjoyment."
TitMainTitle: Alpha Kappa Alpha sorority members Nan Moone Currington, Edythe Perkins, and Janet Thompson wearing African clothing, standing behind table with small drum, head sculpture, and rolled animal skin, in domestic interior
